title: This year's incredible British Ecological Society photography competition winners
description: Images of a jumping spider, an elusive gecko and battling birds are among a selection of amazing photos to have been picked in this year's British Ecological Society photography competition.

title: Cooper reflects on cooking 'Sunday Gravy' with Anthony Bourdain
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on inviting Anthony Bourdain into his kitchen to cook a classic New Jersey dish, "Sunday Gravy." Anderson Cooper Full Circle will be back tomorrow on Friday, November 27 at 6p E.T.

title: Student describes professor's Thanksgiving offer as 'too pure for this world'
description: A University of Iowa professor's kindness was embraced by the Internet after her letter offering to drop off Thanksgiving meals to students was shared on Twitter.

title: Rockettes perform at Thanksgiving Parade while wearing masks
description: The Radio City Rockettes sported a new accessory at this Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

title: Gov. Cuomo says SCOTUS ruling on Covid restrictions shows 'it's a different court'
description: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Thursday that a Supreme Court ruling siding with religious organizations in a dispute over Covid-19 restrictions he put in place was in essence the court "making a statement that it's a different court."

title: Hundreds sentenced to life in prison in Turkey's attempted coup trial
description: Hundreds of people were sentenced to life in prison in Turkey on Thursday in  trial linked to a 2016 coup attempt.

title: CNN's Baldwin delivers powerful message about 2020
description: CNN's Brooke Baldwin says healthy and safe Americans should be thankful on Thanksgiving because a pandemic-ravaged year shows us that things can change in a matter of moments.

title: Supreme Court sides with religious groups in a dispute over Covid restrictions in New York
description: In a 5-4 ruling, the Supreme Court sided with religious organizations in a dispute over Covid-19 restrictions put in place by New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo that limited attendance at religious services.

title: Drake sides with The Weeknd, says Grammys 'may no longer matter'
description: Add Drake to the list of people who don't sound happy that The Weeknd was shut out of this year's Grammy nominations.

title: Sudan's last democratically elected prime minister dies of Covid-19
description: Sadiq al-Mahdi, Sudan's last democratically elected prime minister, who was toppled in 1989 by former dictator Omar al-Bashir, died Thursday from coronavirus.

title: Norway ice melt reveals 'frozen archive' of ancient reindeer-hunting arrows
description: Archaeologists have uncovered a haul of ancient artifacts from a melted ice patch in Norway, including a record number of arrows used for reindeer hunting from more than 6,000 years ago.

title: READ: SCOTUS ruling on dispute from religious groups over Covid restrictions
description: In a 5-4 ruling, the US Supreme Court sided with religious organizations in a dispute over Covid-19 restrictions put in place by New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo limiting the number of people attending religious services.

title: Cillizza: Why Trump is (still) forever
description: Whether he's willing to admit it or not, Donald Trump has lost the presidency. And come January 20, he will be gone from the White House. However, that does not mean Trump will magically disappear. In his latest episode of The Point on YouTube, CNN's Chris Cillizza explains how Trump's political influence will stretch far into the future.

title: 'This is a really big deal': CNN analyst on SCOTUS ruling
description: In a 5-4 ruling, the US Supreme Court sided with religious organizations in a dispute over Covid-19 restrictions put in place by New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo limiting the number of people attending religious services.

title: Trump's holiday message contradicts experts' warnings
description: President Donald Trump's annual Thanksgiving proclamation calls for Americans to "gather" for the holiday, even though federal public health officials have explicitly warned against it.

title: Ethiopia enters 'final phase' of operation in Tigray region, says Prime Minister
description: Ethiopia has entered the "final phase" of a "law enforcement" military operation in the northern restive region of Tigray after a 72-hour deadline to surrender expired, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed tweeted in a statement on Thursday.

title: Diego Maradona lying in honor at Argentina's presidential palace
Disney is laying off 32,000 employees
description: Walt Disney Co. is laying off 32,000 employees, about 4,000 more than previously announced, as the coronavirus pandemic continues to hammer its parks and resorts business.

title: Bidens: We're letting go of the traditions we can't do safely
description: This Thanksgiving, tables throughout our country will have an empty chair.

title: Mads Mikkelsen replaces Johnny Depp for third 'Fantastic Beasts' movie
description: Mads Mikkelsen will replace Johnny Depp as the villainous dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald in the third "Fantastic Beasts" movie, Warner Bros. Pictures has announced in a statement.

title: Swedish runestones open gateway to ancient Viking civilization
description: Drive north of the Swedish capital for about half an hour and you'll reach the lakeside district of Vallentuna, a pleasant community with cobblestone churches, picnic areas and playgrounds.

title: Smack talk set to fuel $2.5 million hole-in-one charity challenge
description: There's likely to be smack talk aplenty at Friday's $2.5 million hole-in-one charity challenge as four of US sports A-listers contest the third Match golf event.

title: Pakistani cricketers on 'final warning' after six players breach isolation rules
description: Six Pakistani cricket players are in isolation in New Zealand after testing positive for Covid-19, according to New Zealand's national cricket body on Thursday, and the whole squad has been issued with a "final warning" after several members were seen breaching rules on isolation.

title: Europe pushes to rescue Christmas despite sacrifice of other religions
description: 2020 has been far from festive, but as the year comes to an end, many of Europe's governments are scrambling to avoid stringent lockdowns over the Christmas holidays.

title: In Trump and Biden, reality and fantasy collide on Thanksgiving
description: Coronavirus infections are skyrocketing. Unemployment is rising. Food lines are getting longer. And President Donald Trump is tweeting.

title: An otherworldly underwater sculpture park will open in Miami
description: Starting next year, Miami Beach visitors looking for their next art pilgrimage will be heading to the ocean floor.

title: Activists are demanding reform on abortion rights in Namibia
description: What do you do when your country is torn between decriminalizing abortion and maintaining its colonial abortion laws? Start a debate.

title: South Korean leader of online sexual blackmail ring sentenced to 40 years
description: The South Korean leader of an online sexual blackmail ring that targeted minors and young women was sentenced to 40 years in jail on Thursday, marking the end of an explosive criminal case that sparked outrage across the country.

title: US nurse dies while rescuing paraplegic patient from a house fire
description: A home nurse in Louisiana is being hailed a hero for saving her paraplegic patient from a house fire that ultimately killed her, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Chris Cuomo pokes fun at Don Lemon's outfit
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo pokes fun at Don Lemon's outfit and compares him to actor Richard Roundtree's character in the 1971 movie "Shaft."

title: How this Parisian bistro loved by Bourdain is coping with second lockdown
description: French restauranteurs have been hit hard by two nation-wide lockdowns. Unions say that two out of every three establishments in the hotel and restaurant sector could go out of business as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

title: Couple finds more than 66 bottles of Prohibition-era whiskey hidden in the walls of their New York home
description: When a New York couple was told their over 100-year-old home was built by a notorious bootlegger, they passed it off as small town legend.

title: Trump announces pardon for Michael Flynn in tweet
Teacher's decades-old find on a Northern Ireland beach turns out to be the island's first-ever dinosaur discovery
description: You never know what you might find while walking along the beach.

title: A tale of two bridges: India and China vying for influence in the Maldives
description: In the heart of the Indian Ocean, a 2.1-kilometer (1.3-mile) bridge snakes out of an idyllic atoll, linking the Maldives' capital Malé with its international airport.

title: NRA says it's aware of 'significant diversion of its assets' in tax filing
description: The National Rifle Association says in a tax filing that it became aware of a "significant diversion" of its assets in 2019 and previous years, and that its current president has paid back nearly $300,000 plus interest in funds for the expenses, according to the filings.

title: The reason we know it's about to get better
description: Is it morning in America yet? Not quite. But there's change in the air, and millions of Americans must surely be experiencing the unmistakable feeling that even if the worst is not over, it soon will be.

title: Acting head of USAID tests positive for Covid-19
description: John Barsa, the acting head of the US Agency for International Development, has tested positive for coronavirus, CNN has learned.

title: British-Australian academic freed by Iran in apparent prisoner exchange
description: Kylie Moore-Gilbert, the British-Australian academic detained by Iran for more than two years on espionage charges, has been freed in an apparent prisoner exchange for three Iranians.

title: Analysis: How Flynn perfectly explains Trump's presidency
description: Three weeks into Donald Trump's presidency, he fired Michael Flynn as his national security adviser. On Wednesday, eight weeks to the day when Trump will leave the White House, he pardoned Flynn for lying to the FBI as part of the investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election.

title: The cities designed for a world with 9 billion people
description: Today's cities are grappling with problems ranging from gridlocked traffic and overflowing landfills, to unaffordable housing and growing inequality. Without action, those problems will only get worse.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell is woken up in her cell every 15 minutes by flashlight to see if 'she is breathing,' her lawyer says
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, the former girlfriend of Jeffrey Epstein who is accused of grooming and abusing underage girls, is woken up every 15 minutes to see if she's alive, according to a letter filed by her attorney Tuesday.

title: See stark contrast between Trump and Biden's words this week
description: CNN's John Avlon breaks down President Trump's unwillingness to accept the results of the 2020 election.

title: Opinion: At Thanksgiving, an America of obscene contrasts
description: At my family's Thanksgiving table, we begin the meal by saying what we're thankful for, and every year we list the same themes: We are grateful for our health. For the food on the table. We are grateful that we have one another.

title: There is a hunger crisis in America this Thanksgiving
description: It took just 10 minutes for Regina Status to pick up her Thanksgiving basket in front of her Bronx, New York, apartment. A last-minute delivery from Agatha House Foundation, a local food pantry, arrived just in time.

title: Woman relying on food bank: You just have to survive it
description: Regina Status is one of 50 million Americans who won't have enough to eat this year, in part because of the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Vanessa Yurkevich reports on food insecurity this Thanksgiving.

title: Europe was largest contributor to new Covid-19 cases and deaths in the past week, WHO says
